text.text: How do ICD-10 diagnosis codes work in ZOLL Billing?

text: ICD-10 diagnosis codes are stored at the payer's level on a claim. During claim creation, ICD-10 diagnosis codes are added when a primary payer is created.

text.text: Can you explain how ICD-10 diagnosis codes are handled on a claim in ZOLL Billing?

text: When you move from a primary payer to the secondary / tertiary payer, the ICD-10 diagnosis codes from the primary payer are copied to the secondary / tertiary payer. You can change the copied ICD-10 diagnosis codes to anything you want.

text.text: What happens to ICD-10 diagnosis codes when moving from primary to secondary/tertiary payer in ZOLL Billing?

text: When you move from a primary payer to the secondary / tertiary payer, the ICD-10 diagnosis codes from the primary payer are copied to the secondary / tertiary payer. You can change the copied ICD-10 diagnosis codes to anything you want.

text.text: How can I change ICD-10 diagnosis codes for a specific payer in ZOLL Billing?

text: ICD-10 diagnosis codes are stored at the payer's level on a claim. During claim creation, ICD-10 diagnosis codes are added when a primary payer is created. When you move from a primary payer to the secondary / tertiary payer, the ICD-10 diagnosis codes from the primary payer are copied to the secondary / tertiary payer. However, you can change the copied ICD-10 diagnosis codes to anything you want.

text.text: What is the importance of checking ICD-10 diagnosis codes for the current payer before submitting a claim in ZOLL Billing?

text: After you change ICD-10 diagnosis codes for a specific payer, it is always a good practice to check them for the current payer before you submit the claim.

text.text: What should I do if an ICD-10 code expires in ZOLL Billing?

text: As ICD-10 expires codes, they will no longer be available in ZOLL Billing. If you have an ICD-10 code that was valid for the date of service of your claim and you change the date of service to one where the ICD-10 code is no longer valid, it will not display in ZOLL Billing.

text.text: Can you provide guidance on fixing ICD-10 codes in Waystar within ZOLL Billing?

text: ICD-10 diagnosis codes are stored at the payer's level on a claim. During claim creation, ICD-10 diagnosis codes are added when a primary payer is created. When you move from a primary payer to the secondary / tertiary payer, the ICD-10 diagnosis codes from the primary payer are copied to the secondary / tertiary payer. However, you can change the copied ICD-10 diagnosis codes to anything you want.

text.text: Where can I find information about expiring ICD-10 codes in ZOLL Billing?

text: ICD-10 codes expire on a regular basis. It is important to keep track of the expiration dates of your ICD-10 codes so that you can update them as needed. You can find information about expiring ICD-10 codes in the ZOLL Billing help documentation.

text.text: How do I ensure that the correct ICD-10 code is selected for a claim's date of service in ZOLL Billing?

text: If the claim's date of service is older than the effective date of the ICD-10, that ICD-10 code will not show.

text.text: What actions should I take if I don't see the desired ICD-10 code in the list while entering diagnosis codes for a claim in ZOLL Billing?

text: If you are entering diagnosis codes on an incomplete claim's Level of Service & Diagnosis tab, and you don't see the ICD-10 code you want in the list, check the date of service. If the claim's date of service is older than the effective date of the ICD-10, that ICD-10 code will not show.

text.text: Can you explain the process for managing ICD-10 diagnosis codes within ZOLL Billing?

text: ICD-10 diagnosis codes are stored at the payer's level on a claim. During claim creation, ICD-10 diagnosis codes are added when a primary payer is created. When you move from a primary payer to the secondary/tertiary payer, the ICD-10 diagnosis codes from the primary payer are copied to the secondary/tertiary payer. However, you can change the copied ICD-10 diagnosis codes to anything you want. Changes to ICD-10 diagnosis codes will persist for that payer only.

text: If the claim's date of service is older than the effective date of the ICD-10, that ICD-10 code will not show.
